meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by cart.
meanings.sent1: The cartage of the heavy boxes was tiring for the workers.
meanings.sent2: The company charged a fee for the cartage of the supplies to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The cartage of the oversized pumpkin in the tiny cart was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the market, a cartage of joy for all to hear.
meanings.sent5: The cartage of colorful balloons floating in the sky was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The cost of transporting goods by cart.
meanings.sent1: The cartage for shipping the goods across town was surprisingly high.
meanings.sent2: The cartage for the delivery included both the distance and weight of the items.
meanings.sent3: The cartage for the short trip seemed like a small fortune to the old man.
meanings.sent4: The cartage for the service was a heavy burden on the small business.
meanings.sent5: The cartage for the luxurious items was worth every penny for the customer.
